com.proximyst.sewer

Class SewerSystem.Builder<Input,Output>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.proximyst.sewer.SewerSystem.Builder<Input,Output>
  • Type Parameters:
    Input - The input type of the entire system. This does not change.
    Output - The output type of the system thus far. This may change with every #pipe call.
    Enclosing class:
    SewerSystem<Input,Output>

    public static class SewerSystem.Builder<Input,Output>
extends Object
    A builder to create a new SewerSystem.

    • Method Detail

      • pipe

        public <NewOutput> SewerSystem.Builder<Input,NewOutput> pipe(@NonNull SewerPipe<Output,NewOutput> pipe)
        Attach a new pipe to the system.
        Type Parameters:
        NewOutput - The new output for the system.
        Parameters:
        pipe - The pipe to attach. This must take an instance of Output as input.
        Returns:
        This builder with the new pipe attached.

      • pipe

        public <NewOutput> SewerSystem.Builder<Input,NewOutput> pipe(@NonNull String pipeName,
                                                             @NonNull PipeHandler<Output,NewOutput> handler)
        Attach a new pipe to the system.
        Type Parameters:
        NewOutput - The new output for the system.
        Parameters:
        pipeName - The name of the pipe to attach.
        handler - The handler of the pipe to attach. This must take an instance of Output as input.
        Returns:
        This builder with the new pipe attached.

      • pipe

        public <NewOutput> SewerSystem.Builder<Input,NewOutput> pipe(@NonNull String pipeName,
                                                             @NonNull PipeHandler<Output,NewOutput> handler,
                                                             @Nullable FiltrationModule<Output> preFlowFilter)
        Attach a new pipe to the system.
        Type Parameters:
        NewOutput - The new output for the system.
        Parameters:
        pipeName - The name of the pipe to attach.
        handler - The handler of the pipe to attach. This must take an instance of Output as input.
        preFlowFilter - The filter to run before the pipe. May be null.
        Returns:
        This builder with the new pipe attached.

      • pipe

        public <NewOutput> SewerSystem.Builder<Input,NewOutput> pipe(@NonNull String pipeName,
                                                             @NonNull PipeHandler<Output,NewOutput> handler,
                                                             @Nullable FiltrationModule<Output> preFlowFilter,
                                                             @Nullable FiltrationModule<NewOutput> postFlowFilter)
        Attach a new pipe to the system.
        Type Parameters:
        NewOutput - The new output for the system.
        Parameters:
        pipeName - The name of the pipe to attach.
        handler - The handler of the pipe to attach. This must take an instance of Output as input.
        preFlowFilter - The filter to run before the pipe. May be null.
        postFlowFilter - The filter to run after the pipe. May be null.
        Returns:
        This builder with the new pipe attached.

      • exceptionHandler

        public SewerSystem.Builder<Input,Output> exceptionHandler(@NonNull Consumer<PipeResult.Exceptional<?>> consumer)
        Set the exception handler for the system.

        This does not delegate to the old handler.

        Parameters:
        consumer - The new exception handler.
        Returns:
        This builder with the new exception handler attached.

      • build

        public SewerSystem<Input,Output> build()
        Build the SewerSystem with the pipes attached.

        This clones the pipeline, and the builder may therefore be used again after the call.

        Returns:
        A new SewerSystem akin this builder.
